citeinfo.title: National Lakes Assessment 2012 Analysis Sample Frame

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract: The National Lakes Assessment (NLA) Analysis Sample frame shapefile represents the full set of all possible lake objects used for development of the US EPA Natioanl Lakes survey design including supplemental designs for other states and territories. Most importantly, this shapefile includes all fixes made to the spatial representation of lakes due to information collected from the 2012 lake evaluation process, incorporating imagery, topo maps, and local information. This lake frame is intended to represent all lakes, reservoirs and ponds within the contiguous Untied States greater than 1 hectare in surface area that are permanent water bodies. The frame was derived from the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) and more specifically using the NHDPlus medium-resolution (1:100,000) data set containing value-added attributes to the underlying NHD data set. The frame was further refined based on previous NLA lake frames.
descript.purpose: To represent all lakes, reservoirs and ponds within the contiguous Untied States greater than 1 hectare in surface area that are permanent water bodies for development of the NLA survey design for the US EPA and to reflect refinements to the spatial representation of lakes based on lake evaluation process. Further, refinements to the spatial represenation of lake objects will be incorporated into weight adjustments used in the analysis phase of the 2012 NLA.
descript.supplinf: The primary input to the National Lakes Assessment shapefile was a representation of all waterbodies in the recent version of NHDPlus. This framework was tied to the previous 2007 National Lakes Assessment which was also derived from NHDPlus. All lakes should persist and be trackable across surveys. Additional processing steps in creation of the current lake frame are outlined in metadata processing steps.

idinfo.accconst: Data Are Restricted to Internal EPA Personnel Only and State Partners.
idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Design Ftype based on NHD FTYPE
NHD reach code from NLA 2007 sample frame
NHD COMID from NLA 2007 sample frame (primary)
NHD COMIDs from NLA 2007 sample frame when multiple polygons from 2007 sample frame were combined for 2012 sample frame
x-coordinate from US Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic projection EXCEPT Hawaii sites which are calculated from Hawaii Albers Equal Area Conic projection
y-coordinate from US Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic projection EXCEPT Hawaii sites which are calculated from Hawaii Albers Equal Area Conic projection
State two-letter codes for all states lake polygon occurs in
Percent of lake area that occurs in ST_NLA2012 (Majority state)
State lake is assigned to for NLA 2012
State border lake = Yes; state non-border lake = No
Land ownership dervied from USGS fedlands shapefile
Yes is Urban lake, No is non-urban lake. Defined using WBDC 12 digit HUCs that intersects US Census Urban Clusters
attr.attrdefs: NLA, US Census and NRCS (http://www.census.gov/geo/www/ua/uaucbndy.html and http://www.ncgc.nrcs.usda.gov/products/datasets/watershed/)

attr.attrdef: Lake elevation in meters from NED
CEC North American Level III ecoregion code
CEC North American Level II ecoregion code

CEC North American Level I ecoregion code
CEC North American Level I ecoregion name
Include means lake included in NLA 2007
NES lake from National Eutrophication Survey
State sample frame designation for state design
Include if Lake included in NLA 2012 sample frame; Exclude otherwise
Categories used for unequal probability selection within a stratum
Notes on any changes made to lakes
